questions.userquestion: What type of boat did Miss Suzi have?
questions.author: Steamboat Annie
questions.notes: Why is it that most of the answers to this questions predict dire consequences for me and my kind? All we did was have the misfortune to be hosting a Bell on board.

questions.userquestion: Why did the steamboat have a bell?
questions.author: Wring Mi Bell
questions.notes: As a concerned member of a long line of revered Bells (my grandfather - Liber T. Bell - is retired and currently living in Philadelphia), I have always wondered why so many amature poets tend to use such a horrifying concept coupled with our illustrious last name. We usually take cruises to escape this prejudice. Now we can't even do that.

questions.userquestion: What really happened when Miss Suzi had a steamboat and the steamboat had a bell?
questions.author: Operator Oneringadingee
questions.notes: Many people call and ask me to give them number nine. There has NEVER been any phone number with just one digit, except 0 for Operator. Whenever someone asks me to give them number nine, I always tell them to go to a place that ryhmes with bell.

questions.userquestion: Is there an Operator abuse hotline?
questions.author: Ree F.R. Gerator
questions.notes: I have heard so many people threaten to cut off, well, it is unmentionable here, so let's just say it is a part of a human's anatomy... Anyway, I have heard the threat that if a caller is disconnected they will cut of this part of the operator's anatomy. I hope there are social services for threatened operators.

answers.author: Miss Suzi Squirrel
answers.useranswer: So, the way I understand it, I'm supposed to have a steamboat. Why in the world would I need a steamboat... unless of course there are nuts on board... wait, I see a nut. I'm outtahere

answers.author: Miss Suzi Sloth
answers.useranswer: I wouldn't mind having a steamboat. Is that an answer?
answers.notes: Details about me? Where do I start? I don't have a problem stopping though.

answers.author: Art Dillo
answers.useranswer: Do steamboats even accept non-humans as passengers? I think this is a question that should be answered in a court of law. My answer is hit the road jack!

answers.author: Timmy Turtle
answers.useranswer: I think this is the answer everyone really wants to hear: Miss Susie had a steamboat, the steamboat had a bell, Miss Susie went to heaven the steamboat went to... Hello operator please give me number nine and if you disconnect me I’ll kick you from... Behind the refrigerator there was a piece of glass Miss Susie fell upon it and cut her little... Ask me no more questions, tell me no more lies, Miss Susie told me everything the day before she... Dyed her hair in purple, dyed her hair pink, dyed her hair in polka-dots and washed it down the... Sink me in the ocean, Sink me in the sea, Sink me down the toilet, But please don’t pee on me!
answers.notes: I'm using this forum as a way to start coming out of my shell. Thanks for reading my post.

answers.author: Amanda A.L. Gator
answers.useranswer: I think THIS is the answer everyone is looking for: Miss Suzie had a baby, The baby’s name was Tim, She put him in the bathtub, to see if he could swim, He drank up all the water, He ate up all the soap, He tried to eat the bathtub, but it wouldn’t go down his throat Miss Suzie called the doctor, Miss Suzie tried the nurse, Miss Suzie called the lady with the alligator purse, Mumps said the doctor, Measles said the nurse, Nothing said the lady with the alligator purse, Miss Suzie kicked the doctor, Miss suzie hit the nurse, And then she paid the lady with the alligator purse
answers.notes: If I see any steamboats heading down the river and ANY of the passengers have alligator purses I might not be able to control myself.
